entry.title: Yash159357/BREVITY
entry.summary:
Brevity is a real-time news app that delivers seamless and concise news browsing with infinite scrolling, category news, and personalized theming. Users can quickly search for and access full articles, ensuring they stay informed with the latest updates. Brevity harnesses modern state management and dynamic routing for a smooth, engaging, and effic

ğŸš€ Brevity - Short, Smart, Straight to the point

Stay informed effortlessly with real-time news, seamless navigation, and a personalized reading experience.

ğŸ‘¥ Collaborators


Samarth Sharma
Software Developer
Yash
Software Developer

âœ¨ App Demo


Video 1

Login & SignUp
Video 2

Main Features
Video 3

Additional Features
ğŸ“± View App Screenshots

ğŸŒŸ Features

Core Features

  • Infinite Scrolling - Never hit "the end" â€“ keep scrolling for more stories! ğŸ”„
  • Side Page Navigation -Bookmark articles, adjust settings, and access more details with ease. ğŸ“š
  • Theming Support - Users can personalize their reading experience by selecting their preferred theme. ğŸ¨
  • Direct Full Article Access - Easily navigate to the full news article from the app. ğŸŒ
  • Search News - Quickly find news articles based on keywords or categories. ğŸ”
  • Shareability - Effortlessly share the app with friends using share_plus. ğŸ¤

Technical Highlights

  • State Management â€“ Uses flutter_bloc for efficient, scalable, and predictable state handling. âš¡
  • Dynamic Routing â€“ Seamless navigation with go_router for a smooth user experience. ğŸš¦
  • Optimized Caching â€“ Uses cached_network_image for efficient image loading and reduced data usage. ğŸ“¶
  • Engaging Animations â€“ Implements shimmer effects and smooth transitions for a delightful UI. ğŸ¬
  • Modular Architecture â€“ Clean and maintainable codebase with a well-structured project setup. ğŸ—ï¸

ğŸ› ï¸ Tech Stack

  • Frontend: Flutter, Dart, BLoc for state management
  • Backend: Firebase (Authentication, Firestore, Functions)
  • Local Storage: Shared Preferences
  • APIs: News API, Gemini API

Key Dependencies

  1. go_router: For easy and dynamic navigation between screens.
  2. flutter_bloc: Manages state effectively so that your app stays responsive.
  3. firebase_core, firebase_auth, & cloud_firestore: Integrate Firebase services to power backend functionalities.
  4. google_sign_in: Seamlessly lets users log in with their Google accounts.
  5. http: For robust API calls fetching the latest news data.
  6. equatable: Simplifies comparing objects within your business logic.
  7. card_swiper & flutter_card_swiper: Enhance the user interface with cool card-swipe animations.
  8. cached_network_image: Ensures your images load quickly and cache effectively.
  9. shimmer: Adds attractive shimmer effects during image and content loading.
  10. url_launcher: Allows you to open URLs directly from the app.
  11. intl: Formats dates and times to keep everything neat and localized.
  12. gap: Provides spacing utilities for a cleaner layout.
  13. shared_preferences: Stores user settings and preferences locally.
  14. flutter_dotenv: Manages environment variables securely.
  15. share_plus: Makes sharing content a breeze.
  16. showcaseview: Guides new users with in-app feature showcases.

ğŸ“ Folder Structure

brevity/
â”œâ”€â”€ android/               # Android-specific configuration
â”œâ”€â”€ assets/                # Images, logos, etc.
â”œâ”€â”€ ios/                   # iOS project files
â”œâ”€â”€ lib/                   # Flutter main code (controllers, models, views)
â”œâ”€â”€ linux/                 # Linux support
â”œâ”€â”€ macos/                 # macOS support
â”œâ”€â”€ server/                # Node.js + MongoDB backend
â”œâ”€â”€ test/                  # Test files
â”œâ”€â”€ web/                   # Web support and assets
â”œâ”€â”€ windows/               # Windows support
â”œâ”€â”€ pubspec.yaml           # Flutter dependencies
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md              # Project documentation
â””â”€â”€ .gitignore             # Git ignore rules

ğŸ“² Installation & Setup

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

  • Flutter SDK (3.29.2 or higher)
  • Dart SDK (3.7.2 or higher)
  • Android Studio or VS Code with Flutter extensions
  • Git

ğŸš€ Quick Start

  1. Clone the Repository

    git clone https://github.com/Yash159357/BREVITY
cd brevity

  2. Install Dependencies

    flutter pub get

  3. Set up Environment Variables

    Create a .env file in the root directory of the project:

    touch .env

    Add the following content to your .env file:

    # .env file contents
GEMINI_API_KEY=your_gemini_api_key_here
NEWS_API_KEY=your_news_api_key_here

  4. Get Your API Keys

    For Gemini API:

    • Visit Google AI Studio
    • Create a new API key
    • Copy the key and replace your_gemini_api_key_here in the .env file

    For News API:

    • Visit NewsAPI.org
    • Sign up for a free account
    • Copy your API key and replace your_news_api_key_here in the .env file

  5. Firebase Setup

    • Go to Firebase Console
    • Create a new project or use an existing one
    • Add your Android/iOS app to the project
    • Download the google-services.json (Android) or GoogleService-Info.plist (iOS)
    • Place them in the respective directories:
      • Android: android/app/google-services.json
      • iOS: ios/Runner/GoogleService-Info.plist

  6. Run the Application

    # For debug mode
flutter run

# For release mode
flutter run --release

ğŸ”® Future Plans

We're constantly evolving and have some exciting ideas in the pipeline to make Brevity even more engaging and trustworthy:

  • Chatbot Integration: Develop a smart chatbot that helps users discuss news and delve into details, aiming to curb misinformation through fact-checking conversations. ğŸ¤–
  • Enhanced UI/UX: Roll out sleek design updates and smoother animations to further elevate the user experience. ğŸ¨
  • Beginner Tutorial: Create an in-app tutorial for new users, guiding them through the app's features and best practices for navigating the news. ğŸ“š
  • Advanced News Sharing: Implement more versatile sharing options, allowing users to easily distribute news stories across social media and messaging apps. ğŸ”—
  • Personalized News Insights: Integrate machine learning to offer personalized news feeds and insights based on user behavior and interests. ğŸ“ˆ
  • Community Engagement Tools: Explore features that allow users to comment, rate, and discuss news articles, fostering a community of informed readers. ğŸ’¬
  • Backend Migration: We are shifting from Firebase to a scalable Node.js + MongoDB backend for greater flexibility, performance, and control over our server architecture. âš™ï¸ğŸš€

ğŸ¤ Contributing

We welcome contributions! Please follow these steps:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone your forked repository (git clone https://github.com/Yash159357/BREVITY)
  3. Create a feature branch (git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature)
  4. Commit your changes (git commit -m 'Add amazing feature')
  5. Push to the branch (git push origin feature/amazing-feature)
  6. Open a Pull Request
